zorkItems

Class Container

  • java.lang.Object
    • zorkItems.Container

  • public class Container
extends java.lang.Object
    A container will hold a certain amount of items, similar to an inventory. It will function as such, and some of them may be able to be brought along and even added to the user's inventory.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Team Silver

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Container(java.lang.String name, int weight, int size, boolean canCarry, java.util.ArrayList<Item> contents)
      The container constructor will have all required fields passed in and initialize them.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Item item)
      this method will be used if a user wants to add an item to a container.
      void bringAlong()
      this method will determine if a container can be added to a user's inventory
      void remove(Item item)
      this method will be used if a user wants to remove an item from the container back into the inventory if the container is not able to be carried, it will not work

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • add

        public void add(Item item)
        this method will be used if a user wants to add an item to a container. It will function in a similar way to drop, but it will be place in a container and not just a room. Inventory management*
        Parameters:

        public void remove(Item item)
        this method will be used if a user wants to remove an item from the container back into the inventory if the container is not able to be carried, it will not work
